newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Forint ends steady vs dlr, BCE Swiss franc popular.
newsitem.headline: Forint ends steady vs dlr, BCE Swiss franc popular.

text.p: The Hungarian forint ended routine interbank trade on Friday virtually unchanged against the dollar, dealers said.
"We followed the dollar/mark cross in average turnover," said Istvan Gere of ING Bank.
The forint closed at 163.67/72 against the U.S. unit after trading right on the central bank's bid throughout the day.

Turnover in the Budapest Commodity Exchange's currency futures section soared to 9.46 billion forints from Thursday's 2.98 billion, with Swiss franc futures accounting for almost half of the total 55,624 contracts.
The German mark finished lower in two maturities and rose in one. The dollar ended mostly higher, and the Swiss franc weakened in three maturities.
December maturity contracts for sterling opened today.
